After deliberating his idea to Cyclonus and Hydras, Tucson smiles over to T=
alon and then casually looks to Hyras.

" An old friend who happened to res=
ide near the Ark.  His health was failing him and he passed on his draconic=
 properties to me."

Straight Shot transforms into robot mode and remains o=
n Talon's shoulder.  

" Hey if we're gonna map out a field grid from up he=
re and down there, we need ta send a group of recon specialists ASAP .  I c=
an go with Waspinator, since we happen to be smaller bots, which appears le=
ss of a threat to anyone, while other groups of smaller bots fans out on th=
e ground."

Tucson nods.

" Good point.  Leo Prime, it's me, Tucson.  It ha=
s come to my attention that an alliance with the enemy is imperative.  For =
now we work together until we have dealt with the threat.  Please meet us a=
t our current location on the ground.  I will fill you in when you arrive. =
 Tell the others what is happening so they are aware of the situation."

Pe=
rpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 9, 2011, at 1:52 AM, Ai=
rshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Hydras/Talon
>  
> =E2=
=80=9CAhh Prime, it seems that your hot head, isnt too hot after all=E2=80=
=9Dhissed Hydras with a ironical tone while he flew towards Tucson and adde=
d=E2=80=9DYess, I had... an unpleasant visitor and brings this dinasours wi=
th him; unlucky, we had to defend ourself. And eventought, i dislike work w=
ith you, this is one of those ocations that I have to.  Cyclonus, show to o=
ur... Visitors the information that you gather. Take in count Tuscon and ol=
d pal, that as sing of good will; I=E2=80=99ll let you check the informatio=
n that we collect from first hand... By they way, nice beast mode, who=E2=
=80=99s your Tailor?=E2=80=9D
>  
> Talon arrived and flew close to Tucson,=
 she was amazed of Tucson=E2=80=99s new beast form
>  
> From: Sandy Panico=

> Sent: Monday, August 08, 2011 10:50 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> Su=
bject: Re: Strange meetings - the Silver Dragon and the Preds
>  
> 
> 
> T=
ucson pauses and does indeed stop firing and flies a bit of a distance away=
 from Cyclonus.  He turns his attentions to the burning Dinosaurs and then =
back to his enemy.  He senses something strange.  The sense that like himse=
lf, did not anticipate any of the events unfolding.  He turns to face Cyclo=
nus.
>  
> " Rodimus, you're right.  We can not fight them.  We may have to=
 work WITH them instead.  I don't think they're responsible for the massive=
 death and destruction.   Cyclonus!  As much as I hate to admit it, I think=
 we may have to work together if we're going to stop whoever is causing the=
 disturbance.   It may be our only way to stop it."
>  
> Straight Shot arr=
ives with Talon as she now sees events unfolding.
>  
> "Wow, he hasn't gon=
e crazy on anyone.  In fact, it looks like he's trying to actually talk to =
them.  That is so definitely a first."
> 
> Perpetually on the move and con=
stantly busy.
> 
> On Aug 8, 2011, at 9:19 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonu=
s@...>  wrote:
> 
>>  
>> OOC: FYI. I would imagine that Tuscon is ab=
out the same size as

Since Maximals

lso be about

feet or
>> length and the wings perhaps almost the same width. he would not=

>> feasibly be able to surround the Preds, especailly as far out as they
>=
> are spaced. He can try to circle around, but that is a big circle.
>>

s gone too far,

 a roar of sheer rage, he turns on the surrounding Predacons releasing a

 > powerful stream of fire, flames a bright hue of red, yellow and blue.
>>=
 >

tures!"
>> 
>> <NEW>
>> 
>> What stands before TUSCON is nearly ALL the Pre=
dacon forces. The
>> Fuzors SKYSHADOW, INJECTOR and BUZZCLAW seemed to be k=
eeping watch
>> with CYCLONUS flhing lead along with SCOURGE and several sw=
eeps.
>> 
>> DEEPSTRYKE floats high in the air as PHOBIA and BLACK RAZOR ci=
rcle
>> about. as well as WASPINATOR who buzzes about angrilly as he watche=
d.
>> 
>> They are all flying above miles and miles and miles of burning
>>=
 dinosaurs. Beast and reptiles of all sorts! What sorts they were it is
>> =
difficult to tell, being as they are on fire as the Maximals approach.
>> T=
he stench is hideous, and most of the trees and surrounding scrub is
>> bur=
ning along with the reptiles, the preds are darting all around the
>> super=
 large burning pyre.
>> 
>> That is until TUSCON starts firing.
>> 
>> > <O=
LD Straight Shot & Talon>
>> >
>> > As Straight Shot rides with Talon, she =
picks up on Tucson's location and
>> > from a far, realizes what is now tra=
nspiring between him and Hydras! Still
>> > in cross bow mode, she calibrat=
es her systems and weight distribution to fit
>> > Talon's configurations, =
for optimal results.
>> >
>> > " Hydras! Ohhh I can't believe he's gonna fa=
ce off with him again! He
>> > doesn't realize that he needs help! Wait, Oh=
h good, he's not alone, Rodimus
>> > is with him. But still, it doesn't hur=
t ta lend him a hand. I better let
>> > Leo Prime in on this, he's probably=
 wondering why Tucson isn't contacting
>> > him, which is something he's no=
torious for doing. "
>> >
>> > She opens her link to Leo Prime.
>> >
>> > "=
 Leo Prime, it's me, Straight Shot. Talon and I are reaching Tucson's
>> > =
location shortly and I'm sure he hasn't contacted you yet. He's with
>> > R=
odimus and now he's facing off with Hydras. A lotta fire just got deployed
=
>> > and I'm definitely sure it wasn't from Hydras. Tucson's in a really ba=
d
>> > mood, and I think it's about ta get worse."
>> 
>> <NEW>
>> 
>> "Thi=
s is Leo. Judging from your location we are at least several hours
>> from =
you, and that that is for those of us who can fly. You had better
>> get Tu=
scon reigned in until we can get there. Leo Prime. Out."
>> 
>> > <OLD - St=
raight Shot, Talon & Hydras>
>> >
>> > Much to Straight Shot's suspicion, T=
ucson does indeed have the look of an
>> > enraged predator on his draconic=
 face. What he wouldn't do to be able to
>> > sink his sharp claws into Hyd=
ras, tearing at his armor until there was
>> > nothing left. Yet he holds e=
nough restraint to hold back from doing so, for
>> > the time being.
>> >
>=
> > " Many innocent creatures who were native to this planet have lost thei=
r
>> > lives needlessly, no thanks to you and your reign of greed and destr=
uction.
>> > This is NOT our planet and we have NO right taking away what b=
elongs here!
>> > That is what brings me here, Hydras! This planet deserves=
 freedom and I am
>> > here to make sure it gets it!"
>> >
>> > He exclaims=
 with a loud draconic roar, as smoke seeps out of his flaring
>> > nostrils=
 as do a couple of white hot flames.
>> >
>> > With Rodimus still on his ba=
ck, Tucson circles Hydras as the never ending
>> > coils of his long tail c=
reates a ring around the enemy.
>> >
>> > "Rodimus, this is also your chanc=
e to take back something that was taken
>> > from you. No holds barred, do =
what you feel is the right thing, and what
>> > you feel in your spark is r=
ightful to your cause. I will follow suit. We
>> > will fight as one, and a=
s one we will serve judgement to those who deserve
>> > it. "
>> >
>> > He =
remains in his circling pattern, waiting for Rodimus to direct him, in
>> >=
 hopes to help build his confidence as an Autobot Commander. At the same
>>=
 > time, Tucson had to learn to control his greatest weakness, his
>> > unc=
ontrollable temper which left unchecked, had the potential to turn him
>> >=
 into an extremely dangerous individual. Now that he takes on the role of a=

>> > powerful creature, it would prove hard to quell the fire that burns d=
eep
>> > within his spark. He hoped that this partnership would help keep t=
he
>> > balance between the both of them. They would need that more than ev=
er if
>> > they have hopes of stopping Hydras for good.
>> >
>> 
>> <NEW>
>=
> 
>> "Tuscon!" RODIMUS imperiously said from TUSCON's back. "That's alot o=
f
>> Predacons out there. Unless you have some back up out here that I
>> d=
on't know about we are a long way from home." RODIMUS looked around,
>> "I =
see Cyclonus, have you seen Hydras yet?"
>> 
>> It was not fear that moved =
RODIMUS in all this, but a warrior's
>> caution. Even the most fearless of =
warriors had to know when the odds
>> were stacked against them, and when t=
hey had even a snowball's chance
>> of winning a fight. As RODIMUS pulled o=
ut his rifle and targeted the
>> Predacons, he could not help wondering if =
he fires will it get them
>> all killed, and if TUSCON wanted to them to go=
 down in some blaze of
>> glory. Even two primes cannot stand up to the ent=
ire Predacon forces!
>> 
>> CYCLONUS and HYDRAS were by themsevles their eq=
uals and at the moment
>> HYDRAS was not visible, which made the situation =
even more dangerous.
>> And that was not counting all the other Predacons j=
ust waiting to blow
>> them out of the air.
>> 
>> "What are you doing here=
." CYCLONUS' voice came over the comlink over
>> a general frequency. "We h=
ave no quarel with you this night. Continue
>> firing on us and we will wip=
e you from the skies."
>> 
>> There was a wicked chuckle from SKYSHADOW, "I=
 don't think these two
>> would try to take on the entire Predacon army. Ma=
ybe they came to be
>> the dino beasts along with us?"
>> 
>> "He is full o=
f enough hot air." SCOURGE said, sounding almost eager to
>> fight. "Maybe =
he can put it to some good use." SCOURGE's sweeps began
>> to circle outwar=
ds their weapons charging but not yet firing.
>> 
>> "Finish burning the di=
nosaurs." CYCLONUS barked to the other Predacons
>> who seemed to be approa=
ching. "Make sure none of the crazed beasts
>> rises again."
>> 
>> CYCLONU=
S, SCOURGE and the sweeps slid foward, "We will deal with these
>> intruder=
s." DEEPSTRYKE PHOBIA and BLACK RAZOR slid in behind them.
>> 
>> DEEPSTRYK=
E sent HYDRAS a message alerting him to TUSCON's and RODIMUS'
>> appearance=
 and the approach of a flying Maximal. (Talon)
>> 
>> (TAG)
>> 
>> Preston

>>
